meanings.definition: The outermost layer of skin or exoskeleton.
meanings.sent1: The cuticula on the insect's exoskeleton helps protect it from harm.
meanings.sent2: She applied lotion to her cuticula to keep her skin moisturized.
meanings.sent3: The cuticula on the apple made it shiny and appealing.
meanings.sent4: The cuticula of the onion skin was so thin, you could almost see through it.
meanings.sent5: The cuticula felt smooth and slightly rough at the same time.

meanings.definition: A protective or waxy layer covering the surface of a plant.
meanings.sent1: The cuticula on the leaves helped prevent water loss.
meanings.sent2: The plant's cuticula glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cuticula on the flower petals looked like a thin layer of wax.
meanings.sent4: The cuticula acted as a shield, protecting the plant from harsh weather.
meanings.sent5: Touching the cuticula of the plant felt like touching a delicate film.

meanings.definition: A thin film or membrane covering a structure.
meanings.sent1: The cuticula of the bubble popped easily.
meanings.sent2: The cuticula on the window was so thin, it was almost invisible.
meanings.sent3: The cuticula on the book cover made it look shiny and new.
meanings.sent4: The cuticula of the soap bubble shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The cuticula of the balloon was so delicate, it could burst with a gentle touch.
